title: In which universities in Japan I can study for completely free, if I’m not EU citizen but have good score in SAT, ACT etc. and good high school grades in my country and also already entered to an university in my country? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe you just asked the same question about studying in the US and Europe for free. SO the answer is the same. No where Buckeroo. So suck it up and pay. If you ask about Australia, China, India, Antartica the answer will always be the same.
nowhere in Japan. Just because you have good grades does not mean you are smart and have rights to have free education. You just need to pay.
Foreign students here might get a MEXT scholarship that pays some of your living costs but you still have to pay tuition fees and living costs. Universities are not charities.
